    \index{Lib \textit{(package)}!Lib.mudParser \textit{(module)}|(}
\section{Module Lib.mudParser}

    \label{Lib:mudParser}
This is a simple parser for a mud grammar.


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%%                           Class Description                           %%
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

    \index{Lib \textit{(package)}!Lib.mudParser \textit{(module)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse \textit{(class)}|(}
\subsection{Class mudparse}

    \label{Lib:mudParser:mudparse}
Create instance then pass in string which returns a dictionary.

    \raggedright \textbf{\_\_init\_\_}(\textit{self})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
    Create dictionary.

    \vspace{1ex}

    \label{Lib:mudParser:mudparse:preparse}
    \index{Lib \textit{(package)}!Lib.mudParser \textit{(module)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse \textit{(class)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse.preparse \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

    \begin{boxedminipage}{\textwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{preparse}(\textit{self}, \textit{cmd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
    Parses commands to see if meet any special requirements before passing 
    to parsemain.

    \vspace{1ex}

    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{Lib:mudParser:mudparse:stripcap}
    \index{Lib \textit{(package)}!Lib.mudParser \textit{(module)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse \textit{(class)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse.stripcap \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

    \begin{boxedminipage}{\textwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{stripcap}(\textit{self}, \textit{cmd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
    Takes a string, removes instances of a, an and the, then capitalizes 
    and returns list of all elements.

    \vspace{1ex}

    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{Lib:mudParser:mudparse:getverb}
    \index{Lib \textit{(package)}!Lib.mudParser \textit{(module)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse \textit{(class)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse.getverb \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

    \begin{boxedminipage}{\textwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{getverb}(\textit{self}, \textit{cmd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
    sets verb in dictionary to first first word in sentence. Removes first 
    word in sentence.

    \vspace{1ex}

    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{Lib:mudParser:mudparse:getprep}
    \index{Lib \textit{(package)}!Lib.mudParser \textit{(module)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse \textit{(class)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse.getprep \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

    \begin{boxedminipage}{\textwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{getprep}(\textit{self}, \textit{cmd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
    Will return none if token is not a preposition, else will return 
    preposition.

    \vspace{1ex}

    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{Lib:mudParser:mudparse:getnoun}
    \index{Lib \textit{(package)}!Lib.mudParser \textit{(module)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse \textit{(class)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse.getnoun \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

    \begin{boxedminipage}{\textwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{getnoun}(\textit{self}, \textit{cmd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
    Will return list of all words till either list ends or element is a 
    preposition.

    \vspace{1ex}

    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{Lib:mudParser:mudparse:parsemain}
    \index{Lib \textit{(package)}!Lib.mudParser \textit{(module)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse \textit{(class)}!Lib.mudParser.mudparse.parsemain \textit{(method)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

    \begin{boxedminipage}{\textwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{parsemain}(\textit{self}, \textit{cmd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
    Calls functions in order and assigns elements to dict based on return.

    \vspace{1ex}

    \end{boxedminipage}
